CONJUGATES: we (nominative) | us (objective) | our (possessive adjective) | ours (possessive pronoun)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English ūs, from Proto-Germanic *uns, from Proto-Indo-European *ṇs (accusative/dative of *we- 'we').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word that substitutes for a noun or noun phrase, referring to the speaker or writer and one or more other people.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The objective case of the pronoun 'we', used as the object of a verb or preposition, referring to the speaker or writer and one or more other people.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 代词 'we' 的宾格形式，用作动词或介词的宾语，指说话者或写作者以及一个或多个其他人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They invited us to the party last night.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们昨晚邀请我们参加派对。
